intro: Sida leucopetala, commonly known as whiteleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species belonging to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are typically covered in fine, white hairs, giving it its common name. Its small, white to pale pink flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the summer months. Sida leucopetala is often found in disturbed soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
